body: @alex9311 Waiting for Apache infrastructure team to reopen them, but I believe it is possible for us to merge your docs even though it's closed. Will keep you posted.
Sure!
@alex9311 Just want to let you know it is pushed and merged to live documentation. You should be able to see your contribution at http://predictionio.incubator.apache.org. Thanks!
hey @dszeto, thats great! Thanks for getting back to me, cheers

Do you intend to upgrade those?

I think we should either clean those up or mark them obsolete. There were a few mentions about this on the dev mailing list I recall. Probably good to call that out there so efforts are not duplicated.

You might also want to talk to Marcin, who's working on adding integration tests. Maybe these samples can be used for test as well.

Thanks!
Oh, I will subscribe too. Thanks!

LGTM. Thanks!

PIO-6 is fixed in livedoc. Will merge to develop before releasing.
This is great. Thanks!

Testing GitHub integration.

@dszeto Could you please take a look?
Ah yes, I didn't see the issues over at https://issues.apache.org

Hi @djones, thank you so much for the PR! Unfortunately, we cannot distribute binaries via GitHub. Even though we push the tags, GitHub will only create links for downloading sources. We are working on a new Apache branded release that can live on the ASF distribution network. Please stay tuned!
@HyukjinKwon This is awesome. Thank you so much!
OK thanks @dszeto closing now.

Hi @dszeto , I just realised that master branch was created now (I remember we didn't have this before). Do you intend to use this as a main branch and merge develop one to master? In that case I should change the links here to point master branch.
FYI, `https://github.com/apache/incubator-predictionio/commits/v0.9.5` is broken because it seems the tag is missing here.

@HyukjinKwon `master` has always been present. It's used for stable release sources. It follows the model described here: http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/. Please continue using `develop`.

We will have a discussion on dev@predictionio.incubator.apache.org regarding migrating previous tags to the new repo. Thanks for pointing that out!
Thanks for kind explanation. I will keep in mind!
Build failed due to a network glitch on Travis. Changed files should not affect test. Merging. Thanks @HyukjinKwon !
Just to track progress while merging the ActionML fork.

I think this is ready for review. 

The main things here are changes to support trimming data in the PEvents and LEvents somewhat like the formerly experimental Cleanup App did. Also compacts $set/$unsets and dedups, all optional to support templates that do not want certain of these features. Also the use of this feature is a trait that must be added to a template to be used at all. So should have no effect on existing templates unless they are altered. Then afaik it should work for all of them.

Some minor libs were upgraded.

Some docs we modified to add information.

I think a discussion just started on dev@ regarding the inclusion of ex-official templates in the main codebase. If that happens, these tests could use those templates, and in the other way, these templates would always be kept up to date.

@maniteja6799 Would you mind opening a ticket at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PIO and rename this PR's subject to contain the ticket ID please? This would allow updates to this PR reflect on all Apache mailing lists for wider exposure. Thanks!

Notice the PR is from AML Master to Apache develop. When I fix the license and package names they show up as a diff even though the licenses are changed in the develop branch. This and the fact that none of our wrong package names are showing as diffs makes me think this PR is really showing diffs with the master branch. The only way to sort this is to let git do the merge to apache develop and fix any conflicts then. Since this will be a lot of work, can someone review please, or I'll just start the merge on my local copy.

Hello Donald,
Can you please tell me how to open a ticket, Should i need an username,
password to create a new ticket, if so, how can i get one. I am new to
contributions and jira, It would be very nice if you can help me.

Thanks,
Mani Teja.

@maniteja6799 And actually, there are guidelines for making PR here http://predictionio.incubator.apache.org/community/contribute-code/#how-to-issue-a-pull-request. It would be even nicer if the title of this PR follows `[PIO-19] ...` format like other PRs as described the link :).

~~Do you mind if I ask the purpose of this PR? I am really interested in looking through some codes related with PredictionIO but I am not aware of ActionML. I would appreciate if the PR description is filled up and maybe a JIRA if this one is a patch.~~ Ah, I just saw the JIRA. Sorry for noise.

Anything else?
Thanks for helping me..
@maniteja6799 This is great. Thanks!
Hi @pferrel, I believe you are interested in documentation. Do you mind if I ask to review this please?
Why not use the original commits so that authorship is preserved?

@jamesward I am happy to close this. I wanted to tie up the related PRs and fix the similar stuff across the codebase. 

I don't mind which one is merged but maybe we should make sure that we fix the similar nits all across code base. I don't even mind if this one credits to one of those in related PRs.
You definitely could create a single PR that includes those individual commits.  Just add those remotes and cherry pick the commits.

Sure but as you might already know, those commits will remain only in a single commit log as a commit log as this is what the merge script does as far as I know. One main auther per one PR. That's why I just cc you all here so that you all remain in the single commit log. Do you mind if I ask the reviewers to credit this to you instead if the others are fine with this please? I don't want to make this complicated.
That is only true if you squash the commits.  It really isn't a big deal for these kind of changes.  But typical form is to preserve authorship.

No.. I hope I understood correctly. I mean yes I can preserve individual commits but regardless of how many commits exist in a PR,it is merged into a single one. For example, in https://github.com/apache/incubator-predictionio/pull/264 , I pushed several commits but it became a single commit https://github.com/apache/incubator-predictionio/commit/a92edd98314928428780ea03ca2ac221c9614a42. This would not be just merged by clicking the merge button. If this project uses the same script with the one I use, the script will ask the main auther.

Yeah, there are different types of merges.  If you squash then all the commits become one.  If you merge then the original commits are preserved.  Typically you wouldn't squash if the commits had multiple authors.

I am not used to this project but I believe that's dependent on project's rules. At least, some projects in Apache do not allow that. Let me preserve the individual commit if this is allowed. Otherwise, let's just credit to you because the initial idea wasn't from me anyway.
BTW, I don't squash but committers will possibly via the merge script whether I do or not.

@chanlee514 @Ziemin I notice there is a standalone Spark cluster in the Docker container but nowhere in the test seems to use it (I couldn't see any `pio` commands with `--master` argument). Is it planned in the future?

Other than that LGTM and will merge soon.
updating to new pr
Yes we'll add tests for standalone Spark in the future.

Personally, am not to worry about what decision you guys take as long as the spelling mistakes are fixed. I will be happy if you merge them by cherry picking them pr squash the. 

Cheers!

Yup, thanks all for great feedback. Let me clean this up. But IMHO, we still shold not do this in the future though. This will be an example for multiple authors, taking over an old and abandoned PR and tieing up related small PRs.
@dszeto I just rebased and cherry-picked. Could you please take another please?
I first thought this is okay (I have been doing this time to time in another project) but I will be careful of such cases. Thanks all again for bearing with me.
Excellent. Thanks everyone!
inactive PR, eveything is merged into develop branch
inactive, this has been merged with develop
Thanks, merged
Np, btw the download link in this script on the master branch is broken and I don't know what it should be instead :) (github seems to have removed the packages download feature)
This is great! Thanks @chanlee514 !

I'm not sure if license check is the reason for the delay. As you can see here (https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-predictionio/builds/153982829) there's is little difference in execution time for unit testing. In my case running license check locally is almost instant.
I believe the fix should instead point to /gallery/template-gallery
Thanks for the contribution! Would you please take a look at the build failure and fix it?
@aengle1429 is right. @irfanevrens would you mind updating your PR?
Thanks @docherty !
I will close this pull request to fix the build fail, which is due to a scalastyle error and reopen when I fixed it.
@mengdong When you plan to reopen this, please follow instructions at http://predictionio.incubator.apache.org/community/contribute-code/
Please feel free to close this empty PR if you created this by accident.

Thanks for your contribution @bansarishah ! Most of it looks great to me. A few suggested improvement:
- highlight the need to change `appId` in `engine.json`
- or even better, use the `PEventStore` API so that it relies on the app name rather than ID

I will hold this until the Apache release is out. PredictionIO 0.10.0 has reached RC status. Once the final release is published, we will accept this PR after the engine template is modified to use the final released artifact.
Great. Thanks @aniruddha-adhikary !

I have updated template with 'PEventStore' API. Now it works on appName instead appId and have mentioned it's use in README.md
Please consider it.
Thank you
merged with develop

I should also mention that I `install.sh` is not updated in this PR. I could use some advice on how to integrate it with the current build settings, which versions to choose not to make the whole process to convoluted for the users.
!//EXE!.:Jet/boat/ski//H2O1

/ <vehicle>H2O1=COD5? + <3 commits/requestP
!//EXE//!

One more, while I am working on tutorial, there are some broken parts in document that are using angle bracket. It looks it is hard to control on markdown text.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20610244/how-to-use-angle-brackets-in-url-on-github-flavored-markdown

How about changing this to square bracket?
This is a suggestion, so please let me know if this is not a good choice.
Thanks for your contribution! I don't have a problem with replacing angle brackets with square brackets. The only ask from me is to keep it consistent throughout the whole documentation. Thanks!
Thanks!
Thanks!
Thanks!

This looks good to me, but due to the size of this PR, it would be nice to have extra pairs of eyes. Could @pferrel / @EmergentOrder help? This PR would be the first step to making admin API possible.
Thanks @haricharan123 ! Let's merge this when the Apache release is published. There will be name changes to PredictionIO engine artifacts (RE: #292).
@dszeto Okay thanks! I'll keep update it if there is no problem.
@djKooks No problem. Please keep updating. Thanks for your contribution!

I have done one more commit with addition of new template "Topic labelling with Wikipedia" in templates.yaml. It relates to Jira Issue [PIO-34] .
Please consider it.
Thank you.
Thanks @emilyrose !

Hi @bansarishah , now that 0.10.0-incubating has released, would you mind updating your template to use those new artifacts? Once that's done I will merge this in.

You might also want to redo this against the `livedoc` branch if you want your entry to show up immediately on the live web site. Thanks!

I've run RAT license checking after removing .md files from .rat_excludes, and it seems that some files are missing license headers. The results can be seen here: https://travis-ci.org/chanlee514/incubator-predictionio/jobs/166812407

They are obsolete manual docs, so I wanted to check whether I should add license headers or remove the files.
@chanlee514 i saw that those files were in obsolete/ folder, hence I purposely chose to not add headers to them. I suppose they will be purged anyways.
@smarthi Right okay. It seems like they'll be purged with a seperate PR, and maybe we can remove "*.md" from .rat-excludes following the obsolete/ purge

Also, on a related note, some .md.erb files are missing license headers, which the RAT check failed to catch due to excluding the "source/" directory path in .rat-excludes. The results are here: https://travis-ci.org/chanlee514/incubator-predictionio/jobs/166822010. I can work on correcting this issue following acceptance of this PR.

I've created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PIO-40. Feel free to pick it up. :)
I'll merge this PR. Thanks!
Once this is merged, I'll create a new PR for removing obsolete docs

Hi @dszeto , I have updated template to use predictionio new release 0.10.0-incubating.
To merge with livedoc branch i have done pull request "[PIO-34]Update templates.yaml #315"
Please consider it.
Thank you
This was working later .
I am merging this. Thanks @Ziemin !
